channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo

item.description: Holding an inquiry has become one of the British government’s go-to responses to outrageous harm. But that approach can sometimes stall change and del...

item.title: Kamala Harris’s endorsements show Republicans may be paying the price for their newfound anti-business rhetoric
item.description: Anti-business rhetoric erodes a traditional area of Republican advantage.

item.title: Harris and Trump’s Next Moves, and Francine Lashes Southern Louisiana

item.title: Brian Moynihan isn’t pressing Warren Buffett on why he’s selling Bank of America shares
item.description: "I don't know what exactly he's doing because, frankly, we can't ask and we wouldn't ask."

item.title: The Stakes on Presidential Power
item.description: We explain the contrasting approaches Donald Trump and Kamala Harris take to the executive office.

item.title: China tells EV makers to keep tech at home by producing key parts domestically before exporting them for assembly
item.description: The instructions come as companies from BYD to Chery Automobile firm up plans to build factories in Spain to Thailand and Hungary.

item.title: Should Ukraine Launch Western Weapons Deep Into Russia?
item.description: President Biden has refused to allow Ukraine to use long-range Western missiles on Russian military targets, but he appears to be wavering.

item.title: Why a Roth IRA is the ‘holy grail’ retirement account—no matter your income
item.description: "It’s the best possible retirement account anyone could own."

item.title: How a U.N. Agency Became a Flashpoint in the Gaza War
item.description: UNRWA, the U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees, has survived 75 years of Israeli-Palestinian strife. Can it survive the latest conflict?

item.title: Ireland launches privacy inquiry into Google AI data use in EU after halting Meta and X
